title: Why Super Galaxy and not Neon Strike?
body:
As in title, the new skins (especially Shyvana and Kindred) have tight, bright-colored suits that remind me more of the Neon Strike theme (i.e. Vi) than Super Galaxy

EDIT: First, thanks to all of you for the feedback
Second, KateyKhaos commented on a few other topics that they probably won't change the name, but they will consider it:

http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/9lPa4y5z-pbe-bugs-feedback-thread-super-galaxy-kindred?comment=00070000
> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=PBE,application-id=cMKtzQHY,discussion-id=9lPa4y5z,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-05-03T20:15:21.432+0000)
> It was something we did talk about, and Super Galaxy was a name shot around for Neon Strike Vi. Ultimately, we felt this was a more appropriate name. We could certainly bring up the discussion again if you/other feel Neon Strike would be a better name.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/MQPmhJX6-the-new-super-galaxy-skins-dont-really-fit-the-theme?show=flat&comment=000500000000
> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=mNBeEEkI,discussion-id=MQPmhJX6,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2016-05-03T23:18:21.557+0000)
>
> It's not likely that we'll change the name, but I can bring it up at the next team meeting. :)


Judging from the amount of people who pointed at Neon Strike as a better-fitting name, I'm optimistic :)

Edit2: I'm mostly talking about Kindred Shyvana, but since Fizz will be released with them I wrote for all three (I was thinking would be weird to make two similar themes in one patch, but that just happened with Mecha Sion and the two Program skins so, brainfart I guess). I actually have no problems with Fizz as a Super Galaxy skin (and most other comments here seem to agree)

replies.body:
I agree with this. I have no issue with the name change and both fit the Neon Strike theme more than Super Galaxy.

Though I think the reason was the Super Galaxy has mechs whjich Dragon Shyvana and Wolf seem to be
As well as Fizz's Shark
exactly.

This is exactly what I thought when I first saw these skins. Fizz's can pass as Super Galaxy, but Kindred's and Shyv's are much more akin to Neon Strike, maybe even Star Guardian in Shyv's case. 

They aren't bad skins, but they don't seem to have the same feel to them as Rumble's.

Shyv's human form has Gurren Lagann references (star shaped visor, similar outfit to Yoko in the last half of the series), so I'm fine with it remaining Super Galaxy.

Kindred... I'm just not seeing it.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-05-04T00:34:18.340+0000)
>
> Shyv's human form has Gurren Lagann references (star shaped visor, similar outfit to Yoko in the last half of the series), so I'm fine with it remaining Super Galaxy.
> 
> Kindred... I'm just not seeing it.

Lamb is Tengen Toppa Solvernia
Wolf is Tengen Toppa Lagann

http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/gurennlagann/images/b/b8/Tengen_Toppa_Solvernia_screencap.png/revision/latest?cb=20100522154807
This is from the movie I take it? I should go watch that now.. Thanks for the ref btw!

> [{quoted}](name=ArcticSirius,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-04T02:22:31.892+0000)
>
> This is from the movie I take it? I should go watch that now.. Thanks for the ref btw!

Yes you should go and watch the second movie. In my opinion the finally there is way more satisfying.
Then what the hell is Rumble's from????

> [{quoted}](name=Alleo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2016-05-04T02:54:25.248+0000)
>
> Then what the hell is Rumble's from????

Rumbles is Kamina and his mech is both Gurren and Lagann.
Yeah, I think at least one or two of them should be Neon Strike instead, but still, it's rather confusing.

Hey patmax17! 

Just wanted to update and expand on this explanation a bit.

We did have this discussion internally regarding the naming conventions of Neon Strike v. Super Galaxy. We also brought this discussion up again once we heard player feedback around the subject.

And now, the verdict - **we won't be adjusting the names**.

Here's why - We don't deny that these lines are similar, because they are! If we compared them and where they may live in the League of Legends universe, they would certainly be living in the same galaxy/space. 

Originally, as many players mentioned TTGL was an inspiration for Vi initially. We wanted to expand on the line, and in doing so, we expanded the inspirations that we used to create the new skins - we grabbed new inspiration specifically from mechy/shonan anime. 

>  two similar themes in one patch, but that just happened with Mecha Sion and the two Program skins so, brainfart I guess). 

Side note on this. This was actually intentional. We usually try to give legendary skins a unique name - Mecha Zero Sion v. Mecha Kha'Zix. Like Neon Strike and Super Galaxy, Mecha and Program would also likely exist together. Program is in a similar vein, but the shape language and particle language is much different from Mecha, which is why we differentiated them a bit. In regards to the theme as a whole, we're still talkin' robots! :D

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2016-05-04T22:47:01.616+0000)
> We usually try to give legendary skins a unique name - Mecha Zero Sion v. Mecha Kha'Zix. 

But...Super Galaxy Rumble is also legendary....?

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
Specifically why I said usually.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2016-05-04T22:47:01.616+0000)
>
> Here's why - We don't deny that these lines are similar, because they are! If we compared them and where they may live in the League of Legends universe, they would certainly be living in the same galaxy/space. 
> 
> Originally, as many players mentioned TTGL was an inspiration for Vi initially. We wanted to expand on the line, and in doing so, we expanded the inspirations that we used to create the new skins - we grabbed new inspiration specifically from mechy/shonan anime.

I don't see how that's an explanation. If Neon Strike and Super Galaxy are more or less synonymous for the skin line of "shonen/mech anime inspired with bright colors" then shouldn't you just put neon strike on the ones that seem closer to the neon jump suits of sentai series and super galaxy on big mecha with more metallic hues? Like how Sweetheart and Heart Seeker lines are pretty much the same universe but you pick sweetheart for Annie just because she doesn't really have the arrow/cupid theme?

>  If Neon Strike and Super Galaxy are more or less synonymous for the skin line of "shonen/mech anime inspired with bright colors" then shouldn't you just put neon strike on the ones that seem closer to the neon jump suits of sentai series and super galaxy on big mecha with more metallic hues? 

Again, it's a discussion the team had, and decided not to. I'm purely the messenger in this case, and I can see both sides of the argument. IMO, having two names isn't a bad idea because it then potentially means more skins in both the Neon Strike line, as well as Super Galaxy - similar to Final Boss/Battle Boss v Arcade.

>  Like how Sweetheart and Heart Seeker lines are pretty much the same universe but you pick sweetheart for Annie just because she doesn't really have the arrow/cupid theme?

You're right, they would be tied to the same universe. Heartseeker was never specifically explained as a champion with a bow, which is why Orianna was selected as this year's Heartseeker. Sweetheart is more light-hearted, which is why we called it Sweetheart. Also, Annie is really young, so making her a Heartseeker felt like a weird call.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=000e00000000,timestamp=2016-05-05T16:52:22.204+0000)
>
> Again, it's a discussion the team had, and decided not to. I'm purely the messenger in this case.

I get that, I'm just interested to know in why that decision was made. I don't even really care about the decision itself, it's just the reasoning I want to know.

> Originally, as many players mentioned TTGL was an inspiration for Vi initially. We wanted to expand on the line, and in doing so, we expanded the inspirations that we used to create the new skins - we grabbed new inspiration specifically from mechy/shonan anime.

The decision was made based on the expansion of inspirations used for the skin line.

Perhaps the Skins Team's decision-making should be called into question? While the products themselves are absolutely terrific in the area of graphics, I personally believe that they are slowly, but surely, losing sight on making skins to fit specific themes while also not allowing others (specifically Rumble) to indefinitely have the spotlight. In other words, the Skins Team stole Rumble's awesomeness and gave it to other champions...how depressing.

We are always looking into expanding skin lines, which is why there are several skin lines who have more than a full team comp, such as Pool Party. Sure, we could have just made one, but why do that when other champions have such potential for that skin line?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=000e000000000001000000010000,timestamp=2016-05-10T15:52:11.489+0000)
>
> We are always looking into expanding skin lines, which is why there are several skin lines who have more than a full team comp, such as Pool Party. Sure, we could have just made one, but why do that when other champions have such potential for that skin line?

Super Galaxy is a mouthful to say when tagged on Kindred and Shyvanna's already lengthy names (not the case for fizz tho). But Not only I believe Neon Strike is a better name I also believe it sounds better (especially for Fizz). But I always considered **SG** to be a skin line fornspaceship users (aka Rumble) so since fizz gets one in his recall, I guess it's ok to leave him with the tag. But Neon Strike better for Kin and Shyv.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=000e0000000000010000,timestamp=2016-05-05T18:21:56.213+0000)
>
> The decision was made based on the expansion of inspirations used for the skin line.

Ok, so "Super Galaxy" is a defined skin line name that is likely to have skins in the future and "Neon Strike" is just a name on a specific skin that may be considered part of the "Super Galaxy" line despite lacking the name?

If that's the case then my confusion was merely that I didn't realize skin line names were that concretely defined.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=000e00000000,timestamp=2016-05-05T16:52:22.204+0000)
>
> Again, it's a discussion the team had, and decided not to. I'm purely the messenger in this case, and I can see both sides of the argument. IMO, having two names isn't a bad idea because it then potentially means more skins in both the Neon Strike line, as well as Super Galaxy - similar to Final Boss/Battle Boss v Arcade.
> 
> You're right, they would be tied to the same universe. Heartseeker was never specifically explained as a champion with a bow, which is why Orianna was selected as this year's Heartseeker. Sweetheart is more light-hearted, which is why we called it Sweetheart. Also, Annie is really young, so making her a Heartseeker felt like a weird call.

The examples you are using are like comparing apples to oranges. Concerning you're example of battleboss/ final boss vs arcade is a whole different situation... Those are skin lines that are quite different in their color scheme. Those two skin lines convey a sense of good vs evil which I find to be a very appropriate situation. Whereas heartseeker vs sweetheart and neon strike Vi vs super galaxy shyvanna literally have the same color scheme and general aesthetic feel and practically look identical. Having two identical skin lines doesn't provide any positive interaction of any kind. So honestly it just doesn't make any logical sense to me. 

Now to speak to your comment concerning the reasoning behind the choice of Annie's skin name you have failed to acknowledge that Annie is also a pyromaniac (practically demon child) who is 
FAR from being innocent... So actually heartseeker fits her 
personality quite well!

And don't pull the "don't shoot the messenger card". If you don't feel qualified to answer the question with real knowledge on the subject then don't post on the thread. Save us all the headache and take it to someone who knows what they're talking about and direct them to the thread so they can get us a logical answer. You're responses consist of you running around your own words and acting like you were part of the decision and defending it as if you had a key role in the decision. There have been numerous feedback threads in which you've responded to and you've recieved negative responses to your "I know what I'm talking about attitude". One that comes to mind is the large amount of disappointment in the lack of particle changes on the marauder Ashe skin. Everyone disagreed with the choice of not putting red particles on the skin, to which you responded saying that Riot wants to give champs a cheaper skin for people who really enjoy a champ but don't want to spend a lot of money on 
a skin. Exhibit A: Ashe literally has freljord, woad AND Sherwood Forest. 3 cheap skins!!! 2 of which (woad and Sherwood Forest) have particle changes. Imagine that! So you can make a cheap skin and give it particle changes. Prime example of you're logic. We would rather not have a response at all then be given an illogical response that clearly was thought through.
Neither Woad nor Sherwood skins have particle changes.

> [{quoted}](name=Pyrodinium,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=okIn4dwh,comment-id=000e0000000000020000,timestamp=2016-05-10T17:58:24.196+0000)
>
> Neither Woad nor Sherwood skins have particle changes.

Yes they do, her abilities have a slight green tint to them on both skins.
Tl;dr pedantics.
Bad decision

Hi Katey!
I admit I'm a bit sad on this, but I guess we can't always have it the way we'd like it :)

Now I'm wondering: neon strike and super galaxy are similar skin lines, with the same inspiration and probably from the same alternative universe. Now there are four SG skins but only one (old) NS skin. Does it make sense to have two distinct skin lines if they are so similar (it's not like mecha and project, where they are similar but have clear differences)? I know you won't, but wouldn't it make sense to just change Neon Strike Vi to Super Galaxy Vi?

Thanks for replying! :)
We also discussed changing Vi's name, and we decided to keep it the same - similar to how we kept Justicar the same when we created Arclight.
Thanks for the information :)

Neon Strike would be much better for Kindred. 

Super Galaxy works for Fizz.
As long as neon strike is eventually continued with a five man multicolored perfectly coordinating team recall pose, I'm willing to overlook what could have been here.

Honestly, looking at them they do SCREAM Neon Strike.

Super Galaxy was more of a Gurren Lagann/Anime robo theme. Shyv and Kindred are just large blobs of Neon color.
THANK YOU!, they look like neon strike.
Super Galaxy Shyvana has joined DJ Sona, Frostblade Irelia, Neon Strike Vi and Safecracker Evelynn in their special club, if you know what I mean.
http://i3.kym-cdn.com/entries/icons/facebook/000/000/228/dat.jpg
Aurelion Sol be like
I am late, nice to meet you {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
Lol, hi xD
they just don't fit the super galaxy theme at all

My take on it. 

The Kindred and Shyvana skins to me look, to an extend, inspired by the Goku Uniforms of Kill la Kill. I mostly atribute this to the stars present in both skins, on Lamb's chest for Kindred and on the back of Shyvana's hands and a smaller at her chest. These stars look quite a bit like the stars on the Goku Uniforms in Kill la Kill, though the overall astetic is more spacey-ish.

This ties into the Super Galaxy line, specifically Super Galaxy Rumble in that while that skin was certainly a lover letter to the super robot genre in general, quite a few direct references are made to Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann. Many of the people who worked on Gurren Lagann also worked on Kill la Kill. 

So in that sense they are connected to me. But that might just be me reaching. 

Awesome skins though.
As long as I get more power ranger skins i am satisfied.
I think it is to bright for Kindred and Shyvana. The would be better as a Dark Star skin.

super galaxy and neon should be 2 different lines of skins. 

Super galaxy --> champions with mechas, rumble and fizz skins fit perfectly into the theme. 

Neon --> Galaxy heroes (?) with multicolor fluo suits and special weapons i guess? 

They are not the same thing, it's like saying that battlecast and mecha is the same line, which is not.

I'm really not a fan of the Kindred or Shyvana skins. Kindred, specifically Lamb, looks like a muscular bodybuilder with a massive amount of fake tan with that orange colour. Shyvana looks like a clown in bright spandex and the skin doesn't follow her character as half-dragon lady. The colours contrast way too much for my liking.
I have similar feeling on Shyvana and Kindred, but here I was just discussing names, not the skins themselves :)
The Shyvana human form recall also looks A LOT like Neon Strike Vi's recall.

Riot seems to have this weird thing where they make one or two skins in the context of a particular aesthetic line, leave it for a year or two, then make a ton of follow up skins and.. Yeah. Like this is a perfect example. I don't think anyone expected any Super Galaxy "side skins", but, would you look at that? Super Galaxy "side skins".

I think the difference is in the robotic nature of the super galaxy skins.

Kindred has mechanical legs and a robo-wolf and shyvana is supposed to be a mecha pilot,with her dragon form representing her mecha

I saw Super Galaxy Shyvana and thought it looked like Diva from Overwatch.
For those that aren't familiar with Diva, a quick description:

Super Mega Jpop Weeb-rights Battle warrior in pink
